Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani homered leading off the game on his second bobblehead night at Dodger Stadium.
Ohtani sent a 1-2 pitch from Baltimore's Corbin Burnes into right-center for his 42nd homer of the season.
Ohtani went 2 for 4 with three runs scored and stole two bases.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani and his dog Decoy handled ceremonial first pitch duties before the game.
The second Ohtani bobblehead giveaway proved just as popular as the first, attracting long lines of fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed that he was more nervous with the ceremonial pitch than Decoy.
Manager Dave Roberts commented on the high demand for the Ohtani bobblehead and the traffic issues it caused.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Only the first 40,000 fans received the bobblehead, which depicts a smiling Ohtani holding Decoy.
The Dodgers have scheduled one more Ohtani giveaway to mark his first season in Los Angeles after six years with the Angels.
